title: Master RAG Implementation with Anthropic Claude
description: Learn to build powerful Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) systems using Anthropic's Claude models. This hands-on curriculum takes you from basic document processing to production-ready RAG pipelines that can handle complex queries, multiple data sources, and advanced retrieval strategies. You'll gain practical experience with embedding models, vector databases, prompt engineering for RAG, and system optimization - all while building a portfolio of working RAG applications.

prerequisites: Basic understanding of APIs and JSON
metadata.targetAudience: Python developers with basic ML/AI knowledge who want to build intelligent document processing and question-answering systems

phases.title: RAG Foundations & Document Processing
phases.description: Plant the seeds of RAG understanding by building your first document processing pipeline and learning how retrieval augments generation

objectives.description: Understand the core principles of RAG and why it solves LLM limitations
Set up development environment with Anthropic API and essential libraries
Build a basic document ingestion and chunking pipeline
Create your first RAG query using simple text matching

deliverables.title: Document Ingestion Pipeline
deliverables.description: Build a Python script that can load, clean, and chunk various document formats (PDF, TXT, MD)
acceptanceCriteria: Successfully processes PDFs, text files, and markdown documents
Implements intelligent chunking with overlap handling
Includes error handling for corrupted or unsupported files
Outputs structured chunks with metadata (source, page number, etc.)

deliverables.title: Basic RAG Question-Answering System
deliverables.description: Create a simple RAG system that can answer questions about your processed documents using Claude
acceptanceCriteria: Accepts user questions and searches through document chunks
Uses basic text similarity for retrieval (TF-IDF or keyword matching)
Formats retrieved context for Claude API calls
Returns answers with source citations

keyConcepts.definition: A framework that combines information retrieval with language generation, allowing LLMs to access external knowledge during response generation
The process of breaking large documents into smaller, manageable pieces that can be effectively processed and retrieved
The maximum amount of text (measured in tokens) that a language model can process in a single request
When an LLM generates information that sounds plausible but is factually incorrect or not supported by the provided context

phases.title: Semantic Search with Embeddings
phases.description: Watch your RAG system sprout semantic understanding by implementing embedding-based retrieval for more intelligent document search

objectives.description: Implement embedding-based semantic search to replace keyword matching
Set up and configure a vector database for efficient similarity search
Optimize retrieval quality through embedding model selection and chunking strategies
Build evaluation metrics to measure retrieval performance

deliverables.title: Vector Database Implementation
deliverables.description: Set up a vector database (Chroma or Pinecone) and implement document embedding storage and retrieval
acceptanceCriteria: Successfully stores document chunks as embeddings in vector database
Implements efficient similarity search with configurable top-k results
Includes metadata filtering capabilities
Provides performance benchmarks for query response times

deliverables.title: Semantic RAG System
deliverables.description: Upgrade your RAG system to use semantic search instead of keyword matching
acceptanceCriteria: Replaces text-based search with embedding-based similarity search
Handles query embedding generation and similarity scoring
Implements retrieval result ranking and filtering
Demonstrates improved relevance over keyword-based approach

deliverables.title: Retrieval Evaluation Framework
deliverables.description: Build a system to evaluate and optimize retrieval quality using test questions and ground truth
acceptanceCriteria: Creates test dataset with questions and expected relevant chunks
Implements metrics like precision@k, recall@k, and MRR
Compares different embedding models and chunking strategies
Generates evaluation reports with actionable insights

keyConcepts.definition: Dense vector representations of text that capture semantic meaning, allowing for similarity comparisons between different pieces of text
A specialized database designed to store, index, and query high-dimensional vectors efficiently using approximate nearest neighbor search
A measure of how closely related two pieces of text are in meaning, regardless of exact word matches
A metric used to measure similarity between vectors by calculating the cosine of the angle between them

phases.title: Advanced Prompt Engineering for RAG
phases.description: Help your RAG sapling grow stronger branches through sophisticated prompt design and context management for Claude

objectives.description: Master prompt engineering techniques specific to RAG applications
Implement dynamic context management to handle varying amounts of retrieved information
Design prompts that encourage accurate citation and reduce hallucination
Build a prompt template system for different query types and domains

deliverables.title: RAG Prompt Template Library
deliverables.description: Create a comprehensive library of prompt templates for different RAG use cases and query types
acceptanceCriteria: Includes templates for factual Q&A, summarization, comparison, and analysis
Implements dynamic context insertion with proper formatting
Provides templates for different document types (technical, legal, academic)
Includes fallback prompts for low-confidence retrievals

deliverables.title: Context-Aware RAG System
deliverables.description: Build an intelligent system that adapts prompts based on retrieval quality and query complexity
acceptanceCriteria: Analyzes retrieval confidence scores to adjust prompt strategy
Handles cases with too much or too little retrieved context
Implements query classification to select appropriate prompt templates
Includes confidence indicators in responses

deliverables.title: Citation and Source Tracking System
deliverables.description: Develop a robust system for tracking and citing sources in generated responses
acceptanceCriteria: Maintains detailed mapping between generated text and source chunks
Implements multiple citation formats (academic, web, etc.)
Provides clickable source links in responses
Validates that citations actually support the generated claims

keyConcepts.definition: A technique where examples of desired input-output pairs are included in the prompt to guide the model's behavior
A prompting technique that encourages the model to break down complex reasoning into step-by-step explanations
Strategies for organizing and presenting retrieved information to maximize the language model's understanding and response quality
Techniques for instructing the model to properly reference and quote from the provided source material

phases.title: Multi-Modal RAG and Advanced Features
phases.description: Watch your RAG system grow into a strong tree by adding support for images, tables, and complex document structures

objectives.description: Extend RAG capabilities to handle images, tables, and structured data
Implement advanced retrieval strategies like hybrid search and re-ranking

deliverables.title: Multi-Modal Document Processor
deliverables.description: Extend your pipeline to extract and process images, tables, and structured content from documents
acceptanceCriteria: Extracts and processes images with OCR and vision models
Handles table extraction and converts to searchable format
Processes structured data (JSON, CSV) with proper metadata
Maintains relationships between different content types

deliverables.title: Hybrid Retrieval System
deliverables.description: Implement a sophisticated retrieval system that combines multiple search strategies
acceptanceCriteria: Combines semantic similarity with keyword matching and metadata filtering
Implements query expansion and synonym handling
Includes re-ranking model for result optimization
Provides explainable retrieval scores and reasoning

deliverables.title: Conversational RAG Interface
deliverables.description: Build a chat-like interface that maintains conversation context and handles follow-up questions
acceptanceCriteria: Maintains conversation history and context across multiple turns
Handles follow-up questions and clarifications intelligently
Implements conversation memory with relevant context retrieval

keyConcepts.definition: RAG systems that can process and retrieve from multiple types of content including text, images, tables, and structured data
A retrieval approach that combines multiple search methods (semantic, keyword, metadata) for improved accuracy
A post-retrieval process that reorders search results using additional models or criteria to improve relevance
The ability to maintain context across multiple interactions in a conversational RAG system

acceptanceCriteria: Implements intelligent caching for repeated queries and embeddings
